topics.title: Address
topics.body_md: 4151 Leeward Point, Jacksonville, FL 32225

topics.title: Parking
topics.body_md: Use the back driveway by the garage. Do not block neighbors. Enter via the screened pool door to the first glass door on the left.

topics.title: Access method
topics.body_md: Park at the back driveway by the garage. Walk through the screened pool door. Enter the first glass door on your left. Digital lock. Code arrives by 11:00 am on check-in day.

topics.title: Check in window
topics.body_md: From 3:00 pm

topics.title: Network name
topics.body_md: Ukc-rentals

topics.title: Password
topics.body_md: 9niners67

topics.title: Quiet hours
topics.body_md: 11:00 pm to 7:00 am

topics.title: Pets
topics.body_md: No pets

topics.title: Smoking
topics.body_md: No smoking

topics.title: Emergency contacts
topics.body_md: Emergency, dial 911. For urgent issues, contact the host at 216-644-3614 or ukcrentals@gmail.com.

topics.title: Restaurant Orsay
topics.body_md: Fine dining French bistro with Southern influences. Try the steak frites with rosemary-seasoned steak, red wine jus and butter sauce.

topics.title: Cowford Chophouse
topics.body_md: Steakhouse famous for its steaks and duck fat cornbread topped with Maine lobster, lump crab and crème fraîche.

topics.title: The Bearded Pig
topics.body_md: Casual barbecue spot known for its Frito Pie: brisket and beans served over Frito chips with cheese and jalapeño aioli.

topics.title: Indochine
topics.body_md: Thai restaurant voted one of the city’s best. Signature dish: crab rangoon filled with real lump crab and curried cream cheese.

topics.title: Maple Street Biscuit Company
topics.body_md: Southern comfort food. Don’t miss the Squawking Goat: fried chicken and goat cheese medallion on a flaky biscuit with house-made pepper jelly.

topics.title: Palms Fish Camp
topics.body_md: Seafood restaurant serving fresh Mayport shrimp and fish with scenic water views. Try the shrimp and grits or blackened fish.

topics.title: TacoLu
topics.body_md: Lively spot for tacos and tequila. Signature dish: Bangin’ Shrimp Taco with crispy shrimp, cabbage and chipotle cream.

topics.title: The French Pantry
topics.body_md: Cozy lunch spot where the menu changes daily. Their bruschetta comes in multiple options, always made from scratch.

topics.title: Bold Bean Coffee Roasters, Riverside
topics.body_md: House roaster. Consistent espresso.

topics.title: Southern Grounds, Neptune Beach
topics.body_md: All day menu. Good for work sessions.

topics.title: Social Grounds Coffee, Springfield
topics.body_md: Veteran owned. Pour over and cold brew.

topics.title: Le Petit Paris, Southside
topics.body_md: French bakery. Strong coffee.

topics.title: Maple Street Biscuit Company, San Marco
topics.body_md: Hearty breakfast. Solid coffee.

topics.title: Intuition Ale Works, Sports District
topics.body_md: Rooftop. Game day vibe.

topics.title: Aardwolf Brewing Company, San Marco
topics.body_md: Sours and barrel aged standouts.

topics.title: Bold City Brewery, Riverside
topics.body_md: Jax classic.

topics.title: Green Room Brewing, Jax Beach
topics.body_md: Surf crowd favorite.

topics.title: The Brix Taphouse, Jax Beach
topics.body_md: Big tap list near the sand.

topics.title: St. Augustine
topics.body_md: 45 to 60 min. Historic district. Lighthouse. Food scene.

topics.title: Amelia Island and Fernandina Beach
topics.body_md: 45 to 60 min. Victorian downtown. Quiet beaches.

topics.title: Cumberland Island, GA
topics.body_md: About 90 min to ferry. Wild horses. No cars.

topics.title: Ichetucknee or Ginnie Springs
topics.body_md: 2 to 2.5 hours. Tubing. Clear springs.

topics.title: Gainesville and Paynes Prairie
topics.body_md: About 1.5 hours. Bison and wild horses.

topics.title: Jacksonville Baldwin Rail Trail
topics.body_md: 14.5 miles paved. Equestrian path. Multiple trailheads.

topics.title: UNF Robert W. Loftin Nature Trails
topics.body_md: Three loops. Red Maple Boardwalk. Sunrise to sunset.

topics.title: Kathryn Abbey Hanna Park
topics.body_md: 15 miles of trails. Lakeside loops. Beach access.

topics.title: Timucuan Preserve, Spanish Pond and Fort Caroline
topics.body_md: Easy scenic loops.

topics.title: Cummer Museum of Art and Gardens
topics.body_md: Riverfront gardens.

topics.title: Jacksonville Zoo and Gardens
topics.body_md: Family friendly.

topics.title: Catty Shack Ranch Wildlife Sanctuary
topics.body_md: Evening feedings.

topics.title: Riverside Arts Market
topics.body_md: Saturdays under the bridge.

topics.title: Jax Pier area
topics.body_md: Easy beach plus dining.

topics.title: Jacksonville Beach
topics.body_md: Beach access is free. Parking is paid March 1 to November 2 on most Fridays to Sundays and some areas. Free Monday to Thursday outside events. Street parking outside the core can be free on weekdays. Check signs.

topics.title: Neptune and Atlantic Beach
topics.body_md: Public access is free. Mix of free street parking and posted pay zones near town centers. Check signs.

topics.title: Little Talbot Island State Park
topics.body_md: Undeveloped beach. 5 dollars per vehicle.

topics.title: Kathryn Abbey Hanna Park
topics.body_md: Oceanfront park with trails and splash pad. 5 dollars per car. 3 dollars walk in or bike.

topics.title: Pumpkin Hill Creek Preserve
topics.body_md: Quiet paddling and hiking. No entrance fee.

topics.title: George Crady Fishing Pier
topics.body_md: Great sunrise walk and fishing. 2 dollars per person.

topics.title: Work with Wi‑Fi
topics.body_md: Southern Grounds or Bold Bean.

topics.title: Sunset beer
topics.body_md: Green Room or Intuition rooftops.

topics.title: Easy family walk
topics.body_md: UNF boardwalk or Jax Baldwin from Camp Milton.

topics.title: Full day coastal escape
topics.body_md: Amelia Island or Little Talbot.

topics.title: Book direct to save
topics.body_md:
Book securely on our site. Direct is best for price and support.

https://ukcrentals.holidayfuture.com

brand.font_stack: system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Arial, sans-serif

items.title: Jacuzzi / Hot Tub
steps: Remove cover and secure safely.
Set temperature to 100–102°F.
Press Jets to start, adjust air control dials.
After use, turn Jets off and replace cover.

items.title: Propane Grill
steps: Open the lid.
Turn gas valve on at the tank.
Set burner to Ignite and press igniter.
Preheat 10 minutes. After use, close valve and clean grates.

items.title: Thermostat
steps: Tap mode to Heat/Cool/Auto.
Set target temperature.
Fan Auto for normal use.

items.title: Kitchen Appliances
steps: Microwave: time, power level, Start/Stop.
Oven: bake temp, preheat indicator.
Coffee maker: fill water, insert grounds/pod, press Brew.

items.title: Washer & Dryer
steps: Washer: add detergent to drawer, select cycle, press Start.
Dryer: clean lint trap, select cycle, press Start.

items.title: Smart TV & Streaming
steps: Power on TV and streaming stick.
Connect to Wi‑Fi Ukc-rentals.
Open desired app and sign in if needed.

items.title: Keypad Entry
steps: Enter code sent at 11:00 am day of check‑in.
Lock by pressing the Lock icon when leaving.
